db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: AnchorAnimation is used to animate an anchor change.
In the following snippet we animate the addition of a right anchor to a Rectangle:

When an AnchorAnimation is used in a Transition, it will animate any AnchorChanges that have occurred during the state change. This can be overridden by setting a specific target item using the AnchorChanges.target property.

db:note.db:para: AnchorAnimation can only be used in a Transition and in conjunction with an AnchorChange. It cannot be used in behaviors and other types of animations.

db:member.db:link: Animation and Transitions in Qt Quick

db:section.db:title: duration : int
db:section.db:para: This property holds the duration of the animation, in milliseconds.

db:section.db:title: easing group
db:section.db:para: Specifies the easing curve used for the animation
To specify an easing curve you need to specify at least the type. For some curves you can also specify amplitude, period and/or overshoot. The default easing curve is Linear.
See the PropertyAnimation::easing.type documentation for information about the different types of easing curves.

db:section.db:title: [read-only] targets : list<Item>
db:section.db:para: If no targets are specified all AnchorChanges will be animated by the AnchorAnimation.
